content: 14 16 row in total don t hesitate to adjust according to how tight or loose you want your sleeves to be meaning you should be about ten row down in total once there try on the top see if you need to add more increases if the sleeves fit then you can join the front and the bottom of the top while skipping the sleeves holes see illustration 2 p 6 to body under the yoke continue alternating tc and double_crochet row - while turning your work each time - until you reach your preferred length for the top though here are some landmarks to help you anticipate better your final result final size indicator counting yoke + body and before blocking xs ≈ 21 row → 13 7 inches/ 35 cm s ≈ 23 row → 14 7 inches/ 37 5 cm m ≈ 24 row → 15 7 inches/ 40 cm l ≈ 25 row → 16 7 inches/ 42 5 cm xl ≈ 27 row → 17 7 inches/ 45 cm xxl ≈ 29 row → 18 7 inches/ 47 5 cm for the final stitch cut the yarn leaving about 6 inch/ 15 cm tail thread your yarn needle and insert under both loops of the next stitch the first of this row you re working on from front to back pull through and go through the v of the last stitch you made tighten and secure with the knot that you can hide inside your project good job you re done please also note that double_crochet and treble_crochet stitches are to become looser when you block the top the final length and width of the top can then increase by a lot i used superwash wool which has a high growth tendency after blocking © copyright jeannalicce 2025 illustration 1 dividing the chain chain stitch marker front 19 21 23 25 27 29 chain stitches sleeve sleeve space 2 space 1 same as 8 9 10 11 sleeve 1 back 12 13 chain same as front stitches see below for size chart and written explanations where to place the stitch markers on the first chain here is a chart that breaks down the amount of stitches you need according to the size that you re aiming at* refer to illustration above to visualize the position of each part *measuring has been calculated according to size standards feel free to modify to your preferred fitting - but be aware of proportions and symmetry © copyright jeannalicce 2025 illustration 2 closing the sleeves skip the sleeve s space and join the front to the back panel just connect the two parts together with either a double_crochet or treble_crochet depending on which stitch you re working on on this row see demo below ↓↓ 1 2 3 4 here is the potential sleeve space of course yours should be bigger -
